intro: Senecio ansteadii, commonly known as the Ansteadii groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, blue-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
